title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 November 2016 - XWiki
content:
<tom\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:33 <tom\_\_> hi there, could anyone tell me if there is an extension or something to use @username tagging like on confluence or other platforms? so you can mention each other in comments or posts? thank you very much :)  
05:38 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
05:45 <edvorg> has quit  
05:46 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
05:46 <edvorg> has quit  
05:47 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <mflorea> has quit  
09:51 <robi\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <robi\_> hi all.. i run a tomcat/mariadb installation on linux sles .. and i want to run a 8.4 xwiki. now i have the problem, that i cant use ldap anymore, i already put jldap and ldap-api jar into the /lib directory ... is there something i am missing? thx for answer  
09:53 <edvorg> has quit  
10:03 <tmortagne> robi\_: you mean upgrade to 8.4  
10:03 <tmortagne> ?  
10:04 <tmortagne> it would really be better for the long term to install LDAP authenticator with Extension Manager  
10:04 <tmortagne> otherwise upgrade are going to be a pain  
10:05 <tmortagne> if you don't have any pure XWiki user you can enable superadmin user in xwiki.cfg  
10:05 <tmortagne> then you install the LDAP authenticator, change what needs to be changed in the conf and disable superadmin  
10:06 <tmortagne> robi\_: see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/Data/XWiki/8.3/#HLDAPModulemovedtoContrib  
10:07 <robi\_> i cant access the internet from my server  
10:07 <robi\_> so install through extension manager is not possible sadly  
10:07 <tmortagne> I see  
10:08 <tmortagne> no way to use some proxy ?  
10:08 <robi\_> no its completly seperate environment  
10:08 <tmortagne> ok then indeed not super easy  
10:09 <robi\_> is it possible to import the extension somehow?  
10:09 <robi\_> like a package?  
10:09 <tmortagne> back to your question, you are talking about jldap and ldap-api jars but I don't see the authenticator listed  
10:09 <robi\_> i am fine with configuring ldap in the xwiki.cfg ... isnt the authenticator just used for the gui?  
10:10 <tmortagne> the authenticator is the authenticator, what deal with authentication :)  
10:10 <tmortagne> the UI is another extension  
10:11 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/  
10:11 <tmortagne> jldap and ldap-api are just dependencies of the authenticator  
10:13 <robi\_> oh ok.. so which jar i need for the authenticator?  
10:13 <robi\_> this one? http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/  
10:22 <tmortagne> you have a download button on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/  
10:24 <tmortagne> robi\_: actually I made a mistake ldap-api is not required for the authenticator right now, only the UI use it so authenticator+jldap is enough  
10:24 <robi\_> ok good it works now  
10:24 <robi\_> but somehow mappins work differently  
10:25 <robi\_> i couldnt use my config from before (last\_name = sn) etc  
10:32 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <martinus\_\_> hi there, I'm trying the curl API example at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XWikiRESTfulAPI to create a new page  
11:33 <martinus\_\_> curl returns an upload status and that's all  
11:33 <martinus\_\_> the page isn't created  
11:33 <martinus\_\_> what could be the issue ? (the username I use is correct)  
11:34 <martinus\_\_> and it seems something is transfered but I don't know much more than that  
11:36 <martinus\_\_> I'm using curl -u xx:yy -X PUT --data-binary "@pagexwiki.xml" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" https://domain.ltd/rest/wikis/main/spaces/Main/pages/test2  
11:36 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, do you have an experience about that ?  
11:36 <tmortagne> robi\_: it's supposed to work exactly the same  
11:40 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: I don't have much experience with curl but looks good especially if you get a proper answer  
11:40 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, I don't get the documented answer  
11:40 <martinus\_\_> I get a transfer status, nothing more  
11:40 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: do you have access to server log ?  
11:40 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, yes !  
11:40 <tmortagne> maybe there is some error there  
11:40 <martinus\_\_> ok let's see  
11:41 <martinus\_\_> absolutely nothing :(  
11:42 <tmortagne> what http code do you get in the response ?  
11:43 <tmortagne> are you sure the wiki in right in your URL ?  
11:43 <tmortagne> just on case: the id of the main wiki is "xwiki", not main  
11:43 <tmortagne> s/on case/in case/  
11:44 <tmortagne> the URL you gave means the following document reference: "main:Main.test2"  
11:48 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, same thing with rest/wikis/xwiki/spaces/Main/pages/test2 (replaced main by xwiki). I got no http code, only a transfer status with rates etc  
11:48 <martinus\_\_> strange  
11:49 <tmortagne> not sure I understand what you means exactly by transfer status, either you get an HTTP response or you get nothing  
11:49 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, I mean this http://pastebin.com/qvKt3mQX  
11:49 <tmortagne> at least if it reaches XWiki it will send you back a HTTP response whatever happen  
11:50 <martinus\_\_> I fully agree  
11:51 <tmortagne> sorry I have no idea what http://pastebin.com/qvKt3mQX means, what produces this report ? curl ?  
11:51 <martinus\_\_> yes curl  
11:51 <martinus\_\_> ok I'll investigate. Thanks for your help tmortagne ;)  
11:51 <tmortagne> maybe you do get an HTTP response but you need to tell curl to display it  
11:52 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, I'm just using the exact syntax used in xwiki documentation  
11:52 <martinus\_\_> I'll investigate  
12:02 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, there was two issues: the wiki name and a username issue in my latest tests  
12:03 <martinus\_\_> thanks again  
12:03 <tmortagne> ok, glad you found it  
12:18 <edvorg> has quit  
12:24 <tom\_\_> has quit  
12:48 <robi\_> what else would i need for the guy next to the authenticator, jldap and ldap-api?  
12:50 <robi\_> somehow my config for mapping user attributes dont work anymore.. debug says not much, i can login with the user etc but somehow first and last name wont get imported into the xwiki... i wanna try it with the gui now  
13:32 <Pbas> robi\_:  maybe, check xwiki.authentication.ldap.update\_user=1 in xwiki.cfg and your user attributes in ldap (ie cn/uid/... renamed) and I noticed in 8.4 that I must modify a user property to test user updating  
14:51 <robi\_> regarding my ldap problem... i get the debug logs (Invalid DN Syntax) .. i used DOMAIN\{0} in the gui for binding to the ldap server, which worked.. but after that it says "can't find any attributes for user [DOMAIN\user] and it creates a local user which the information i typed in (user & password).... the strange thing is, that it finds all my group mapping and the users that are in this group which should get mapped to it  
14:52 <robi\_> so i think there is a problem finding the account somehow even tho i can bind to the ldap  
15:33 <tmortagne> robi\_: might be a regression actually but I'm surprised nobody reported it, the issue if that the authenticator expect the bind DN to be a proper DN which DOMAIN\user is not  
15:34 <tmortagne> I guess AD accept its special non standard form for bind but not for search  
15:34 <tmortagne> let me try something  
15:49 <tmortagne> robi\_: just release a 9.1.1 version that should fix LDAP-38, you get get it on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/  
15:50 <tmortagne> tell me if it's better  
16:20 <msmeria> has quit  
17:06 <robi\_> it works thx :)  
17:09 <robi\_> but not everything.. group mapping still doesnt work ... i tried with few users now.  
17:09 <robi\_> the way i use it now is .. i use a static user to authenticate to the AD .. it works fine like thtat  
17:10 <robi\_> \*that  
17:37 <robi\_> has quit  
17:41 <mflorea> has quit  
18:43 <evalica> has quit  
19:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has quit  
19:34 <vmassol> has quit  
23:44 <tmortagne> has quit  
23:49 <evalica> has joined #xwiki
